column2: Climate Neutrality (2040 target under discussion)
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Setting Climate Targets" because it discusses the climate neutrality target for 2040.

column2: CBAM
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Carbon Pricing" because it mentions the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM).

column2: For the period from 2021 to 2025 each Member State shall ensure that greenhouse gas emissions  from the sector do not exceed greenhouse gas removals, calculated as the sum of total emissions and total removals on its territory in all of the land accounting categories (no debit rule).
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Greenhouse Gas Emissions Reduction" because it discusses the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Set up at least one renewables-based energy community in every municipality with a population higher than 10.000
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Renewable Energy Communities" because it discusses setting up renewables-based energy communities.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the contribution of renewable fuels of non-biological origin used for final energy and non-energy purposes shall be at least 42 % of the hydrogen used for final energy and non-energy purposes in industry by 2030, and 60 % by 2035
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Hydrogen Production" because it discusses the contribution of renewable fuels of non-biological origin to hydrogen production.

column2: Bring online over 320 GW of solar photovoltaic by 2025 and 600 GW by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Solar Energy" because it discusses the installation of solar photovoltaic capacity.

column2: By 31 December 2025, each Member State shall agree to establish a framework for cooperation on joint projects with one or more other Member States for the production of renewable energy, subject to the following: by 31 December 2030, Member States shall endeavour to agree on establishing at least two joint projects
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Renewable Energy Cooperation" because it discusses cooperation on joint projects for renewable energy production.

column2: Member States shall endeavour to increase the share of renewable sources in the amount of energy sources used for final energy and non-energy purposes in the industry sector by an indicative increase of at least 1,6 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the periods 2021 to 2025 and 2026 to 2030.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Renewable Energy Integration" because it discusses increasing the share of renewable sources in the industry sector.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the total final energy consumption of all public bodies combined is reduced by at least 1,9 % each year, when compared to 2021
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Efficiency" because it discusses reducing energy consumption.

column2: Member States shall make efforts to collectively contribute to the indicative Union primary energy consumption target amounting to no more than 992,5 Mtoe in 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Consumption Reduction" because it discusses reducing primary energy consumption.

column2: Reduce buildings' final energy consumption by 14%
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Building Energy Efficiency" because it discusses reducing buildings' energy consumption.

column2: At least double the annual energy renovation rate of residential and non-residential buildings by 2030 and to foster deep energy renovations
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Building Renovation" because it discusses increasing the energy renovation rate of buildings.

column2: Indicative national targets aiming to achieve the deep renovation of at least 35 million building units by 2030 to support reaching an annual energy renovation rate of 3 % or more for the period till 2050
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Building Renovation" because it discusses deep renovation of building units.

column2: The revised directive will make zero-emission buildings the new standard for new buildings.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Zero-Emission Buildings" because it discusses making zero-emission buildings the new standard.

column2: Member States will also have to set out specific measures on the phase-out of fossil fuels in heating and cooling with a view to a complete phase-out of boilers powered by fossil fuels by 2040
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Fossil Fuel Phase-out" because it discusses phasing out fossil fuels in heating and cooling.

column2: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's extraction capacity is able to extract the ores, minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials, to the extent that the Unionâ€™s reserves allow for this
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Critical Raw Materials" because it discusses ensuring access to critical raw materials.

column2: Diversify the Union's imports of strategic raw materials with a view to ensure that the Union's annual consumption of each strategic raw material at any relevant stage of processing can rely on imports from several third countries, none of which provide more than 65% of the Union's annual consumption
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Diversification of Raw Materials" because it discusses diversifying imports of strategic raw materials.

column2: Producers of LMT (Light Means of Transport) batteries or producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets of waste LMT batteries: 51 % by 31 December 2028, 61 % by 31 December 2031.
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Battery Recycling" because it discusses collecting waste batteries.

column2: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency: No later than 31 December 2025 - 65% by average weight of lithium-based batteries, No later than 31 December 2030 - 70% by average weight of lithium-based batteries
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Battery Recycling" because it discusses recycling efficiency targets for lithium-based batteries.

column2: The plastic part in packaging shall contain the following minimum percentage of recycled content recovered from post-consumer plastic waste, per unit of packaging: From 1 January 2030 (i) 30% for contact sensitive packaging made from polyethylene terephthalate (PET) as major component, (ii) 10% for contact sensitive made from plastic materials other than PET, except single use plastic bottles, (iii) 30% for single use plastic beverage bottles, (iv) 35% for other plastic packaging
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Plastic Recycling" because it discusses minimum recycled content in packaging.

column2: Recycling of plastic in packaging: 55%
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Plastic Recycling" because it discusses recycling targets for plastic in packaging.

column2: By 2025, the preparing for re-use and recycling of municipal waste shall be increased to a minimum of 55% by weight (60% by 2030, 65% by 2035)
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Waste Recycling" because it discusses increasing preparing for re-use and recycling of municipal waste.

column2: Hazardous household waste will have to be collected separately by 2022, bio-waste by 2023 and textiles by 2025
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Waste Collection" because it discusses collecting hazardous household waste, bio-waste, and textiles separately.

column2: Renewable and low-carbon fuels should represent between 6% and 9% of the international maritime transport fuel mix by 2030 and between 86% and 88% by 2050
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Maritime Transport" because it discusses the share of renewable and low-carbon fuels in maritime transport.

column2: In the first phase, from 2020 up to 2024, the strategic objective is to install at least 6 GW of renewable hydrogen electrolysers in the EU and the production of up to 1 million tonnes of renewable hydrogen.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Hydrogen Production" because it discusses installing renewable hydrogen electrolysers and producing renewable hydrogen.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, at the end of each year, starting from the year referred to in Article 26, the following power output targets are met cumulatively: (a) for each light-duty battery electric vehicle registered in their territory, a total power output of at least 1,3 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations, and (b) for each light-duty plug-in hybrid vehicle registered in their territory, a total power output of at least 0,80 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Electric Vehicle Charging" because it discusses providing power output for electric vehicles through publicly accessible recharging stations.

column2: Rail freight traffic will increase by 50% compared to 2015 by 2030.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Rail Transport" because it discusses increasing rail freight traffic.

column2: Reduce by 50% the use and risk of chemical pesticides (target in common with the Biodiversity Strategy and Zero Pollution Action Plan)
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Pest Control" because it discusses reducing the use and risk of chemical pesticides.

column2: Sustainable use of water.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Water Conservation" because it discusses sustainable use of water.

column2: Create new job opportunities.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Rural Development" because it discusses creating new job opportunities.

column2: Ensuring all access to quality, safe, sustainable, nutritious food.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Food Systems" because it discusses ensuring access to quality, safe, sustainable, and nutritious food.

column2: 1.a Legally protect a minimum of 30% of the EU's land area
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Habitat Protection" because it discusses legally protecting a minimum of 30% of the EU's land area.

column2: 4. By 2030, significant areas of degraded and carbon-rich ecosystems are restored.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Ecosystem Restoration" because it discusses restoring degraded and carbon-rich ecosystems.

column2: 5. The decline of pollinators is reversed
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Pollinator Conservation" because it discusses reversing the decline of pollinators.

column2: 7. At least 10% of agricultural area is under high-diversity landscape features
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Agriculture" because it discusses having at least 10% of agricultural area under high-diversity landscape features.

column2: 9. Three billion trees are planted in the EU, in full respect of ecological principles
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reforestation" because it discusses planting three billion trees in the EU.

column2: 11. At least 25.000 km of free-flowing rivers are restored
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "River Restoration" because it discusses restoring free-flowing rivers.

column2: 13. The losses of nutrients from fertilisers are reduced by 50%, resulting in the reduction of the use of fertilisers by at least 20%
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Fertilizer Use" because it discusses reducing nutrient losses from fertilizers.

column2: 15. The negative impacts on sensitive species and habitats, including on the seabed through fishing and extraction activities, are substantially reduced
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Marine Conservation" because it discusses reducing negative impacts on sensitive species and habitats in the marine environment.

column2: Member States shall put in place the restoration measures that are necessary to improve to good condition areas of habitat types listed in Annex II which are not in good condition.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Habitat Restoration" because it discusses restoring habitat types listed in Annex II.

column2: Providing financial incentives for forest owners and managers for improving the quantity and quality of EU forests
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Forest Management" because it discusses providing financial incentives for improving the quantity and quality of EU forests.

column2: (forest ecosystems) Member States shall achieve an increasing trend at national level of the common forest bird index, as further set out in Annex VI, measured in the period from the date of entry into force of this Regulation until 31 December 2030, and every six years thereafter, until the satisfactory levels identified in accordance with Article 11(3) are reached
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Forest Conservation" because it discusses achieving an increasing trend of the common forest bird index.

column2: Reach no net land take
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Land Use" because it discusses reaching no net land take.

column2: Providing financial incentives for forest owners and managers for improving the quantity and quality of EU forests
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Forest Management" because it discusses providing financial incentives for improving the quantity and quality of EU forests.

column2: Establish locally integrated urban wastewater management plans to combat pollution from rain waters (urban runoff and storm water overflow).
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Urban Water Management" because it discusses establishing locally integrated urban wastewater management plans.

column2: Member States will be required to improve and maintain access to sanitation for all, in particular for vulnerable and marginalised
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sanitation Access" because it discusses improving and maintaining access to sanitation for all.

column2: Member States shall take the measures necessary to ensure that water intended for human consumption is wholesome and clean.
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Drinking Water Quality" because it discusses ensuring water intended for human consumption is wholesome and clean.

column2: Reach good chemical and quantitative status in groundwaters and surfacewaters
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Water Quality" because it discusses reaching good chemical and quantitative status in groundwaters and surfacewaters.

column2: Minimise or eliminate the use of pesticides in sensitive areas such as urban green areas
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Pesticide Reduction" because it discusses minimizing or eliminating the use of pesticides in sensitive areas.

column2: Reach energy neutrality in the wastewater treatment sector by 2040. To reach energy neutrality and the additional treatment of nitrogen, GHG emissions would be reduced by 4,86 million tonnes (37,32 % of the avoidable emissions from the sector)
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Greenhouse Gas Emissions" because it aims to reduce GHG emissions by 37,32% in the wastewater treatment sector.

column2: Reach energy neutrality in the wastewater treatment sector by 2040. To reach energy neutrality and the additional treatment of nitrogen, GHG emissions would be reduced by 4,86 million tonnes (37,32 % of the avoidable emissions from the sector)
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Energy Efficiency" because it aims to reach energy neutrality in the wastewater treatment sector.

column2: Each Member State shall ensure that the annual sum of its greenhouse gas emissions and removals on its territory and in all of the land reporting categories, in each year in the period from 2026 to 2030, does not exceed the limit established by a linear trajectory, ending in 2030 on the target set out for that Member State(no debit rule)
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Greenhouse Gas Emissions" because it sets a limit on the annual sum of greenhouse gas emissions and removals for each Member State.

column2: Over this decade, the EU will need to install, on average, approximately 45 GW per year of PV to reach the share of 45% of energy coming from renewables set out in the REPowerEU Plan
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Solar Energy" because it specifically mentions the installation of PV to reach a share of 45% of energy coming from renewables.

column2: Over this decade, the EU will need to install, on average, approximately 45 GW per year of PV to reach the share of 45% of energy coming from renewables set out in the REPowerEU Plan
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Increasing Renewable Energy" because it aims to increase the share of energy coming from renewables.

column2: Member States shall collectively ensure that the share of energy from renewable sources in the Unionâ€™s gross final consumption of energy in 2030 is at least 42,5 %.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Increasing Renewable Energy" because it sets a target for the share of energy from renewable sources in the Union's gross final consumption of energy.

column2: Member States shall set an indicative target for innovative renewable energy technology of at least 5 % of newly installed renewable energy capacity by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Innovative Technologies" because it sets a target for innovative renewable energy technology.

column2: Member States shall endeavour to increase the share of energy from renewable sources and from waste heat and cold in district heating and cooling by an indicative 2,2 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2021 to 2030, starting from the share of energy from renewable sources and from waste heat and cold in district heating and cooling in 2020
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Increasing Renewable Energy" because it aims to increase the share of energy from renewable sources in district heating and cooling.

column2: Renovate each year at least 3% of the total floor area of buildings owned by all levels of public administration (as also agreed by Council-Parliament on 10.03.23)
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Energy Efficiency" because it aims to renovate buildings to improve energy efficiency.

column2: All existing buildings should be transformed into zero-emission buildings
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Energy Efficiency" because it aims to transform all existing buildings into zero-emission buildings.

column2: The national measures will have to ensure that at least 55% of the decrease of the average primary energy use is achieved through the renovation of the worst-performing buildings
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Energy Efficiency" because it aims to ensure that a significant portion of the decrease in primary energy use is achieved through building renovation.

column2: The strategy sets targets for an installed capacity of at least 60 GW of offshore wind by 2030 and at least 300 GW by 2050.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Wind Energy" because it specifically mentions offshore wind.

column2: The strategy sets targets for an installed capacity of at least 60 GW of offshore wind by 2030 and at least 300 GW by 2050.
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Increasing Renewable Energy" because it aims to increase the installed capacity of offshore wind.

column2: The strategy sets targets for an installed capacity of at least 1 GW of ocean energy by 2030 and 40 GW by 2050.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Ocean Energy" because it specifically mentions ocean energy.

column2: The strategy sets targets for an installed capacity of at least 1 GW of ocean energy by 2030 and 40 GW by 2050.
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Increasing Renewable Energy" because it aims to increase the installed capacity of ocean energy.

column2: Halve the amount of residual (non-recycled) municipal waste
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Waste" because it aims to halve the amount of residual municipal waste.

column2: by 2030, manufacturing capacity in the Union of the strategic net-zero technologies listed in the Annex approaches or reaches a benchmark of at least 40% of the Unionâ€™s annual deployment needs for the corresponding technologies necessary to achieve the Unionâ€™s 2030 climate and energy targets
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Sustainable Technologies" because it aims to increase the manufacturing capacity of strategic net-zero technologies.

column2: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency: No later than 31 December 2025, - 75% by average weight of lead-acid batteries, - 80% by average weight of nickel-cadmium batteries, - 50% by average weight of other waste batteries
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Recycling" because it sets targets for recycling efficiency.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials: No later than 31 December 2027, - 90% for cobalt, copper, lead, nickel
column3: No later than 31 December 2031, - 95% for cobalt, copper, lead, nickel
column4: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: Improving Recycling
column6: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Recycling" because it sets targets for recovery of materials.

column2: From 2025, beverage bottles listed in Part F of the Annex which are manufactured from polyethylene terephthalate as the major component (â€˜PET bottlesâ€™) contain at least 25 % recycled plastic, calculated as an average for all PET bottles placed on the market on the territory of that Member State
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Increasing Recycling Rate" because it aims to increase the use of recycled plastic in PET bottles.

column2: From 15 August 2018, the recovery targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 85% for Category 1 (temperature exchange equipment) or Category 4 (large equipment with any external dimension more than 50 cm), - 80% for Category 2 (e.g., screens and monitors), - 75% for Category 5 (small equipment with no external dimension more than 50 cm) or 6 (Small IT and telecommunication equipment with no external dimension more than 50 cm)
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Recycling" because it sets targets for recovery of WEEE.

column2: From 15 August 2018, the preparation for re-use targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 80% for Category 1 or Category 4, - 70% for Category 2, - 55% for Category 5 or Category 6
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Recycling" because it sets targets for preparation for re-use of WEEE.

column2: From 15 August 2018, the recycling targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 0% for Category 1 or Category 4, - 70% for Category 2, - 55% for Category 5 or Category 6
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Recycling" because it sets targets for recycling of WEEE.

column2: Member States with maritime ports should endeavour to ensure that from 2030 the share of renewable fuels of non-biological origin in the total amount of energy supplied to the maritime transport sector is at least 1,2 %.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Increasing Renewable Energy" because it aims to increase the share of renewable fuels of non-biological origin in the maritime transport sector.

column2: Reduce the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations by at least 10% within 7 years
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Transport Efficiency" because it aims to reduce the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations.

column2: In a third phase, from 2030 onwards and towards 2050, renewable hydrogen technologies should reach maturity and be deployed at large scale to reach all hard-to-decarbonise sectors where other alternatives might not be feasible or have higher costs.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Hydrogen Technologies" because it aims to deploy renewable hydrogen technologies at large scale.

column2: By 31 December 2030 (with intermediate 2025 and 2027 targets), along the TEN-T core road network, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles are deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km between them [...] (with intermediate 2025 and 2027 targets).
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Electric Vehicle Infrastructure" because it aims to deploy publicly accessible recharging pools for heavy-duty electric vehicles.

column2: By 31 December 2030, in each urban node publicly accessible recharging points dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an aggregated power output of at least 1 800 kW are deployed, provided by recharging stations with an individual power output of at least 150 kW.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Electric Vehicle Infrastructure" because it aims to deploy publicly accessible recharging points for heavy-duty electric vehicles.

column2: Member States shall ensure that by 31 December 2030 publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling stations designed for a minimum cumulative capacity of 1 tonne per day and equipped with at least a 700 bar dispenser are deployed with a maximum distance of 200 km between them along the TEN-T core network
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Hydrogen Infrastructure" because it aims to deploy publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling stations.

column2: Member States shall ensure that at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T core inland waterway ports by 1 January 2025, at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T comprehensive inland waterway ports by 1 January 2030.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Electric Vehicle Infrastructure" because it aims to deploy shore-side electricity supply installations for inland waterway vessels.

column2: Member States shall ensure that a minimum shore-side electricity supply for seagoing container ships and seagoing passenger ships is provided in TEN-T maritime ports.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Electric Vehicle Infrastructure" because it aims to provide shore-side electricity supply for seagoing container ships and passenger ships.

column2: There will be at least 30 million zero-emission cars and 80.000 zero-emission lorries in operation
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Zero-Emission Vehicles" because it aims to increase the number of zero-emission cars and lorries in operation.

column2: Increase sustainable fishing and aquaculture. Bring fish stocks to sustainable levels. Significant increase in organic aquaculture.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Sustainable Fishing" because it aims to increase sustainable fishing and aquaculture.

column2: Reduce food waste. Prevent food loss and waste. Halve per capita food waste at retail and consumer levels
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Food Waste" because it aims to reduce food waste and prevent food loss.

column2: Reduce the environmental and climate footprint of the EU food system, operating within planetary boundaries

column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Environmental Sustainability" because it aims to reduce the environmental and climate footprint of the EU food system.

column2: Help farmers and fishers to strengthen their position in the supply chain and to capture a fair share of the added value of sustainable production
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Farmer Income" because it aims to help farmers and fishers strengthen their position in the supply chain.

column2: Create shorter supply chains will support reducing dependence on long-haul transportation.

column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Transport Efficiency" because it aims to create shorter supply chains to reduce dependence on long-haul transportation.

column2: Improve availability of sustainable food. Ensure that the healthy option is always the easiest one. Ensure food supply.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Food Availability" because it aims to improve the availability of sustainable food.

column2: Ensure affordability and access to sufficient, nutritious and sustainable food.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Food Affordability" because it aims to ensure affordability and access to sufficient, nutritious, and sustainable food.

column2: Reverse prevalence of overweight and diet-related diseases
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Public Health" because it aims to reverse the prevalence of overweight and diet-related diseases.

column2: Effectively manage all protected areas, defining clear conservation objectives and measures, and monitoring them appropriately
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Conservation Management" because it aims to effectively manage all protected areas.

column2: The risk and use of chemical pesticides is reduced by 50%, and the use of more hazardous pesticides is reduced by 50%
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Chemical Pesticides" because it aims to reduce the risk and use of chemical pesticides.

column2: There is a 50% reduction in the number of Red List species threatened by invasive alien species
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Protecting Biodiversity" because it aims to reduce the number of Red List species threatened by invasive alien species.

column2: The by-catch of species is eliminated or reduced to a level that allows species recovery and conservation
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Protecting Biodiversity" because it aims to eliminate or reduce the by-catch of species.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the condition is known for at least 90% of area distributed overall habitat types listed in Annex I by 2030 and 100% by 2040.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Conservation Management" because it aims to ensure that the condition of habitat types is known.

column2: Restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Restoring Degraded Land" because it aims to restore degraded land and soil.

column2: Improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses and chemical pesticidesâ€™ use by 50% (target partially in common with the Farm to Fork strategy and Biodiversity strategy) - focus on water quality and chemical pesticides
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Soil Quality" because it aims to improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses and chemical pesticides' use.

column2: Improve air quality to reduce the number of premature deaths caused by air pollution by 55%
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Air Quality" because it aims to improve air quality to reduce premature deaths caused by air pollution.

column2: Reduce significantly total waste generation and by 50% residual municipal waste

column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Waste" because it aims to reduce total waste generation and residual municipal waste.

column2: Improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses and chemical pesticidesâ€™ use by 50% (target partially in common with the Farm to Fork strategy and Biodiversity strategy) - focus on water quality and nutrient loss

column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Soil Quality" because it aims to improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses and chemical pesticides' use.

column2: The revision of the Ambient Air Quality Directives would merge the Directives into one, and seek to: align EU air quality standards more closely with WHO recommendations further improve the legislative framework (e.g. in relation to penalties, and public information)

column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Air Quality" because it aims to improve the legislative framework for air quality.

column2: 2040 target under discussion
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Setting Emission Targets" because it discusses a specific target for reducing emissions by 2040.

column2: The total quantity of allowances for the new emissions trading system should follow a linear trajectory to reach the emission reduction target for 2030, taking into account the cost-efficient contribution of the buildings and road transport sectors of 43 % emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005 and of the additional sectors, a combined cost-efficient contribution of 42 % emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Setting Emission Targets" because it outlines a specific plan for reducing emissions through the emissions trading system.

column2: To achieve 55% reduction of GHG emission by 2030, methane emissions related to energy production and consumption should be reduced by 58% compared to the level in 2020
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Methane Emissions" because it specifically focuses on decreasing methane emissions from energy production and consumption.

column2: Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: (a) the amount of renewable fuels and renewable electricity supplied to the transport sector leads to a: (i) share of renewable energy within the final consumption of energy in the transport sector of at least 29 % by 2030, or i) greenhouse gas intensity reduction of at least 14,5 % by 2030, compared to the baseline set out in Article 27(1), point (b), in accordance with an indicative trajectory set by the Member State
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Renewable Energy" because it aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the transport sector.

column2: By 2022 achieve 18% of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources between that Member State's binding 2020 national target, and its contribution to the 2030 target of share of energy from renewable sources in gross final consumption of energy. Achieve 43% by 2025, 65% by 2027
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Renewable Energy" because it sets specific milestones for increasing the share of renewable energy sources.

column2: Member States shall determine an indicative national share of renewable energy produced on-site or nearby as well as renewable energy taken from the grid in final energy consumption in their building sector in 2030 that is consistent with an indicative target of at least a 49 % share of energy from renewable sources in the building sector in the Unionâ€™s final energy consumption in buildings in 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Renewable Energy" because it focuses on increasing the share of renewable energy in the building sector.

column2: Member States shall collectively ensure a reduction of energy consumption of at least 11,7 % in 2030 compared to the projections of the 2020 EU Reference Scenario so that the Unionâ€™s final energy consumption amounts to no more than 763 Mtoe
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Energy Efficiency" because it aims to reduce overall energy consumption.

column2: For the non-residential building stock, the revised rules require to gradually improve it via minimum energy performance standards. This will lead to renovating the 16% worst-performing buildings by 2030 and the 26% worst-performing buildings by 2033.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Energy Efficiency" because it focuses on renovating buildings to improve their energy performance.

column2: Around 30% of EU primary steel production is expected to be decarbonized on the basis of renewable hydrogen
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Decarbonizing Industry" because it discusses the use of renewable hydrogen in decarbonizing steel production.

column2: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's processing capacity, including for all intermediate processing steps, is able to produce at least 40% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Securing Raw Materials" because it focuses on ensuring a sustainable supply of critical raw materials.

column2: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's recycling capacity, including for all intermediate recycling steps, is able to produce at least 15% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Recycling" because it aims to increase recycling capacity for strategic raw materials.

column2: Producers of portable batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall ensure that all waste portable batteries, Light Means of Transport (LMT) and SLI batteries, regardless of their nature, chemical composition, condition, brand or origin, are collected separately in the territory of a Member State where they make these batteries available on the market for the first time.
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Recycling" because it focuses on the collection and recycling of batteries.

column2: Producers of portable batteries or producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets for waste portable batteries: 45 % by 31 December 2023, 63 % by 31 December 2027, 73 % by 31 December 2030.
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Recycling" because it sets specific targets for collecting waste portable batteries.

column2: Recycled content in industrial batteries, electric vehicle batteries, LMT batteries and SLI batteries: Cobalt:  16 % by 2031 (26% by 2036), Lead: 85% (85%), Nickel: 6% (12%), Lithium 6% (15%)
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Recycling" because it focuses on increasing the recycled content in various types of batteries.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials: No later than 31 December 2027 -90% for cobalt, copper, lead, nickel
column3: No later than 31 December 2031: -95% for cobalt, copper, lead, and nickel.
column4: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: Promoting Recycling
column6: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Recycling" because it sets targets for the recovery of materials from recycling.

column2: Reduce the generation of food waste per capita, jointly in retail and other distribution of food, in restaurants and food services and in households, by 30 % in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Food Waste" because it aims to decrease food waste generation across different sectors.

column2: Making all packaging recyclable
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Recycling" because it focuses on making all packaging recyclable.

column2: Recycling of wood in packaging: 30%
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Recycling" because it sets a specific target for recycling wood in packaging.

column2: Member States shall meet the target of 77% by weight for the separate collection for recycling of waste single-use plastic beverage bottles by 2025 and 90% by 2029
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Recycling" because it focuses on increasing the collection and recycling of single-use plastic beverage bottles.

column2: The yearly average GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship during a reporting period shall not exceed these limits: 2 % from 1 January 2025, 6 % from 1 January 2030, 14,5 % from 1 January 2035, 31 % from 1 January 2040, 62 % from 1 January 2045, 80 % from 1 January 2050.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Emissions from Transport" because it sets specific limits on GHG intensity for ships.

column2: Starting from 2025, at least 2% of aviation fuels will be green, with this share increasing every five years: 6% in 2030, 20% in 2035, 34% in 2040, 42% in 2045 and 70% in 2050.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Sustainable Fuels" because it aims to increase the use of green fuels in aviation.

column2: Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: (B) the combined share of advanced biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part A of Annex IX and of renewable fuels of non-biological origin in the energy supplied to the transport sector is at least 1 % in 2025 and 3,5 % in 2030, of which a share of at least 1 percentage point is from renewable fuels of non-biological origin in 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Sustainable Fuels" because it sets targets for the use of advanced biofuels and renewable fuels of non-biological origin.

column2: Cut the emissions of transport sector by 90%
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Emissions from Transport" because it aims to significantly cut emissions from the transport sector.

column2: For new urban buses the share of zeroemissions vehicles shall be 100% as from the reporting period of the year 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Electric Vehicles" because it sets a target for all new urban buses to be zero-emission vehicles by 2030.

column2: Transport by inland waterways and short sea shipping will increase by 25% compared to 2015, by 2030.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Sustainable Transport" because it aims to increase the use of inland waterways and short sea shipping.

column2: Scheduled collective travel of under 500 km should be carbon neutral within the EU
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Emissions from Transport" because it focuses on making collective travel carbon neutral.

column2: Nearly all cars, vans, buses as well as new heavy-duty vehicles will be zero-emission
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Electric Vehicles" because it aims for nearly all new vehicles to be zero-emission.

column2: Euro 7 pollutant limits
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Emissions from Transport" because it focuses on setting pollutant limits for vehicles.

column2: The death toll for all modes of transport in the EU will be close to zero
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Transport Safety" because it aims to significantly reduce the death toll from transport accidents.

column2: Zero-emission in urban logistics
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Sustainable Transport" because it focuses on making urban logistics zero-emission.

column2: Increase the uptake of short-sea shipping instead of using more polluting modes
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Sustainable Transport" because it aims to increase the use of short-sea shipping.

column2: Renovate the EUâ€™s maritime fleet (e.g. passenger ships and supply vessels for offshore installations) to improve their energy efficiency
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Energy Efficiency in Transport" because it focuses on renovating the maritime fleet for better energy efficiency.

column2: Pursue the objective of zero-emission ports
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Promoting Sustainable Transport" because it aims to make ports zero-emission.

column2: Cut the emissions of transport sector by 90%
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Emissions from Transport" because it aims to significantly cut emissions from the transport sector.

column2: Reduce overall EU sales of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture by 50% by 2030.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Antimicrobial Use" because it focuses on decreasing the sales of antimicrobials in farming and aquaculture.

column2: Reduce by 50% the use of more hazardous pesticides
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Pesticide Use" because it aims to reduce the use of more hazardous pesticides.

column2: Tackle climate change: climate change adaptation and mitigation. Ensure that agriculture, fisheries and aquaculture, and the food value chain contribute to the target of reducing greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030 and to the achievement of the objective for a climate neutral Union in 2050.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Emissions from Agriculture" because it focuses on reducing GHG emissions from agriculture and related sectors.

column2: Preserve the affordability of food.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Ensuring Food Affordability" because it aims to preserve the affordability of food.

column2: Combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods, and strive to achieve a land degradation-neutral world (SDG 15.3)
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Restoring Degraded Land" because it focuses on combating desertification and restoring degraded land and soil.

column2: (terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems) Member States shall put in place the restoration measures that are necessary to re-establish the habitat types listed in Annex I in areas not covered by those habitat types with the aim to reach their favourable reference area.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Restoring Habitats" because it aims to restore habitat types listed in Annex I.

column2: (terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems) Member States shall ensure that there is: (a) an increase of habitat area in good condition for habitat types listed in Annex I until at least 90 % is in good condition and until the favourable reference area for each habitat type in each biogeographic region of the Member State concerned is reached, (b) an increasing trend towards the sufficient quality and quantity of the terrestrial, coastal and freshwater habitats of the species referred to in Annexes II, IV and V to Directive 92/43/EEC and of the species covered by Directive 2009/147/EC
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Restoring Habitats" because it focuses on improving the condition and area of habitats.

column2: (urban ecosystems) Member States shall ensure that there is no net loss in the total national area of urban green space, and of urban tree canopy cover in urban ecosystem areas.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Preserving Urban Ecosystems" because it aims to prevent net loss in urban green space and tree canopy cover.

column2: (pollinator) Member States shall, by putting in place appropriate and effective measures, improve pollinator diversity and reverse the decline of pollinator populations at the latest by 2030 and achieve thereafter an increasing trend of pollinator populations, following the entry into force of the Regulation and measured every six years after 2030, until satisfactory levels are achieved, as set out in accordance with Article 11(3)
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Protecting Pollinators" because it focuses on improving pollinator diversity and reversing population decline.

column2: (marine ecosystem) Member States shall ensure, by 2030 at the latest, that the condition is known for at least 50% of the area distributed over all habitat types listed in groups 1â€“6 of Annex II.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Restoring Marine Ecosystems" because it aims to improve knowledge of marine ecosystem conditions.

column2: (agricultural ecosystems) Member States shall put in place measures which shall aim to restore organic soils in agricultural use constituting drained peatlands.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Restoring Agricultural Ecosystems" because it focuses on restoring organic soils in agricultural use.

column2: Promoting the sustainable forest bioeconomy for long-lived wood products
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Forest Management" because it promotes sustainable forest bioeconomy.

column2: Promoting non-wood forest-based bioeconomy, including ecotourism
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Forest Management" because it promotes non-wood forest-based bioeconomy.

column2: Ensuring forest restoration and reinforced sustainable forest management for climate adaptation and forest resilience
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Forest Management" because it focuses on forest restoration and sustainable management.

column2: Develop measures to significantly increase efforts to identify, investigate, assess and remediate contaminated sites, so that soil pollution will no longer pose a health or environmental risk

column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Soil Pollution" because it aims to reduce soil pollution by remediating contaminated sites.

column2: Improve water quality by reducing waste, plastic litter at sea (by 50%) and microplastics released into the environment (by 30%)

column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Water Quality" because it focuses on reducing waste and microplastics in water.

column2: Improve nutrient removal from wastewater. Tertiary treatment should be systematically imposed to all urban wastewater treatment plants of 100 000 p.e. and above, as such plants represent an important remaining source of nitrogen and phosphorus discharge.

column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Improving Water Quality" because it aims to improve nutrient removal from wastewater.

column2: Achieve a climate-resilient society status, fully adapted to the unavoidable impacts of climate change
column5: This target is assigned to the Climate Resilience sub-theme because it aims to achieve a society that is fully adapted to the impacts of climate change.

column2: Reduce of 55% GHG emissions compared to 1990 levels (2040 target under discussion)
column5: This target is assigned to the Greenhouse Gas Reduction sub-theme because it aims to reduce GHG emissions by 55% compared to 1990 levels.

column2: Achieve an EU net greenhouse gas removal of 310 million tonnes CO2 equivalent per year for the land use, land use change and forestry (LULUCF) sector, by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Carbon Sequestration sub-theme because it aims to achieve a net greenhouse gas removal of 310 million tonnes CO2 equivalent per year for the LULUCF sector.

column2: Achieve climate neutrality by 2050
column5: This target is assigned to the Climate Neutrality sub-theme because it aims to achieve climate neutrality by 2050.

column2: The share of renewable energy in the electricity mix should double to 55-60%, and projections show a share of around 84% by 2050
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the electricity mix.

column2: By 2030, the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector shall increase by at least 1.1 percentage points as an annual average
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy sub-theme because it aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector.

column2: Each Member State shall ensure that at least 3% of the total floor area of heated and/or cooled buildings that are owned by public bodies is renovated each year
column5: This target is assigned to the Energy Efficiency sub-theme because it aims to renovate buildings to improve energy efficiency.

column2: Doubling the current deployment rate of individual heat pumps, resulting in a cumulative 10 million units by 2027 and 30 million units by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Heat Pumps sub-theme because it aims to increase the deployment of heat pumps.

column5: This target is assigned to the Solar Energy sub-theme because it aims to increase the installation of photovoltaic (PV) systems.

column2: Energy demand to be covered by solar heat and geothermal should at least triple
column5: This target is assigned to the Geothermal Energy sub-theme because it aims to increase the use of geothermal energy.

column2: Over this decade, the EU will need to install, on average, approximately 45 GW per year of PV to reach the share of 45% of energy coming from renewables set out in the REPowerEU Plan
column5: This target is assigned to the Solar Energy sub-theme because it aims to increase the installation of photovoltaic (PV) systems.

column2: The EU will need to increase its wind power capacity to reach the target of at least 40% of its electricity coming from wind power by 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the Wind Energy sub-theme because it aims to increase the use of wind power.

column2: Reduce landfill to a maximum of 10% of municipal waste

column5: This target is assigned to the Waste Reduction sub-theme because it aims to reduce the amount of municipal waste sent to landfills.

column5: This target is assigned to the Recycling sub-theme because it aims to increase the recycling rate of packaging waste.

column5: This target is assigned to the Plastic Reduction sub-theme because it aims to reduce the consumption of lightweight plastic carrier bags.

column5: This target is assigned to the Food Waste Reduction sub-theme because it aims to reduce food waste.

column5: This target is assigned to the Electric Vehicle Charging sub-theme because it aims to increase the deployment of publicly accessible recharging stations for heavy-duty electric vehicles.

column2: Reduce nutrient losses by at least 50%, while ensuring no deterioration on soil fertility
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the Nutrient Loss Reduction sub-theme as it aims to reduce nutrient losses while maintaining soil fertility.

column2: Increase organic farming with the aim to achieve at least 25% of total farmland under organic farming by 2030
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the Organic Farming Promotion sub-theme as it focuses on increasing organic farming.

column2: Increase renewable energy in agriculture and food sector
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the Renewable Energy in Agriculture sub-theme as it aims to increase renewable energy use in the agriculture and food sector.

column2: Protect the environment and restore natural resources
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the Environmental Protection sub-theme as it focuses on protecting the environment and restoring natural resources.

column2: Foster the competitiveness of the EU supply sector
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the Supply Sector Competitiveness sub-theme as it aims to foster the competitiveness of the EU supply sector.

column2: Ensure access to fast broadband to all farmers and all rural areas
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the Rural Broadband Access sub-theme as it focuses on ensuring access to fast broadband in rural areas.

column2: Promote better animal welfare to improve animal health and food quality
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the Animal Welfare Promotion sub-theme as it aims to promote better animal welfare.

column2: Strengthen educational messages on the importance of healthy nutrition, sustainable food production and consumption, and reducing food waste
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the Sustainable Food Education sub-theme as it focuses on strengthening educational messages on sustainable food.

column2: Increase reformulation of food products in line with guidelines for healthy and sustainable diets
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the Food Product Reformulation sub-theme as it aims to increase reformulation of food products.

column2: Move to healthier and more sustainable diets
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the Sustainable Diet Promotion sub-theme as it focuses on promoting healthier and more sustainable diets.

column2: Strengthen the resilience of the EU food system
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the Food System Resilience sub-theme as it aims to strengthen the resilience of the EU food system.

column2: 1.b Legally protect a minimum of 30% of the EU's sea area
column5: This target is assigned to the Marine Protected Areas sub-theme as it focuses on legally protecting a minimum of 30% of the EU's sea area.

column2: 2.a Strictly protect at least a third of the EU'S protected areas
column5: This target is assigned to the Protected Areas Conservation sub-theme as it aims to strictly protect at least a third of the EU's protected areas.

column2: 2b. Strictly protect all remaining EU primary and old-growth forests
column5: This target is assigned to the Forest Conservation sub-theme as it focuses on strictly protecting all remaining EU primary and old-growth forests.

column2: 14. Cities with at least 20.000 inhabitants have an ambitious Urban Greening Plan
column5: This target is assigned to the Urban Greening sub-theme as it aims to have cities with at least 20,000 inhabitants develop an ambitious Urban Greening Plan.

column2: Ensure that incidental catches of sensitive marine species, including those listed under Directives 92/43/EEC and 2009/147/EC, that are a result of fishing, are minimised and where possible eliminated
column5: This target is assigned to the Sustainable Fishing Practices sub-theme as it focuses on minimizing incidental catches of sensitive marine species.

column2: Optimise exploitation patterns to provide protection for juveniles and spawning aggregations of marine biological resources
column5: This target is assigned to the Sustainable Fishing Practices sub-theme as it aims to optimize exploitation patterns to protect marine biological resources.

column2: In accordance with the CFP, all harvested stocks should be fished at maximum sustainable yield (MSY)
column5: This target is assigned to the Sustainable Fishing Practices sub-theme as it focuses on fishing at maximum sustainable yield.

column2: (Restoration of the natural connectivity of rivers and natural functions of the related floodplains) Member States shall make an inventory of artificial barriers to connectivity of surface waters
column5: This target is assigned to the River Connectivity Restoration sub-theme as it aims to restore the natural connectivity of rivers and floodplains.

column2: (marine ecosystem) Member States shall put in place the restoration measures that are necessary to re-establish the habitat types of groups 1-6 listed in Annex II
column5: This target is assigned to the Marine Ecosystem Restoration sub-theme as it focuses on restoring marine ecosystems.

column2: (forest ecosystems) Member States shall achieve an increasing trend at national level of at least six out of seven of the following indicators
column5: This target is assigned to the Forest Ecosystem Restoration sub-theme as it aims to achieve an increasing trend in forest ecosystem indicators.

column2: Ensuring sustainable use of wood-based resources for bioenergy
column5: This target is assigned to the Sustainable Bioenergy sub-theme as it focuses on ensuring sustainable use of wood-based resources for bioenergy.

column2: Developing skills and empowering people for sustainable forest-based bioeconomy
column5: This target is assigned to the Forest-Based Bioeconomy sub-theme as it aims to develop skills and empower people for a sustainable forest-based bioeconomy.

column2: The obligation to set up urban wastewater collecting systems is extended to all agglomerations with a p.e. of 1.000 or more
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the Wastewater Collection sub-theme as it extends the obligation to set up urban wastewater collecting systems.

column2: The Ambient Air Quality Directives set EU air quality standards for 12 air pollutants
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the Air Quality Standards sub-theme as it sets EU air quality standards for 12 air pollutants.

column2: Improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses and chemical pesticidesâ€™ use by 50%
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the Soil Quality Improvement sub-theme as it aims to improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses and chemical pesticides' use.

column2: Improve water quality by reducing waste, plastic litter at sea (by 50%) and microplastics released into the environment (by 30%)
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the Water Quality Improvement sub-theme as it aims to improve water quality by reducing waste and microplastics.

column2: Remove micropollutants from wastewater
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the Wastewater Treatment sub-theme as it focuses on removing micropollutants from wastewater.
